paper.title: A variational eigenvalue solver on a photonic quantum processor

comparisons.description: HeH+ ground state energy near equilibrium (R=0.75 A)

emulator.failure_description: Replication matches published results within error bars

ibm_torino.failure_description: HeH+ R=0.75A mitigation ladder: TREX=4.45, TREX+DD=8.24, Raw=18.94 kcal/mol. Best across 3 distances: R=1.50 TREX=4.31 kcal/mol. Prediction CONFIRMED: TREX gives 2.3-4.3x improvement but NOT chemical accuracy. HeH+ TREX is 20x worse than H2 TREX (0.22 kcal/mol), consistent with coefficient amplification (|g1|/|g4|=7.8 vs 4.4). EstimatorV2 raw baseline (17-19 kcal/mol) far better than SamplerV2+PS (91 kcal/mol).

tuna9.failure_description: HeH+ at R=0.75A on Tuna-9 q[4,6]: 4.44 kcal/mol (REM+PS best). Raw=35.24, PS=5.89, hybrid=5.11 kcal/mol. 20x better than IBM (91.16). Fails chemical accuracy but demonstrates HeH+ is intrinsically harder than H2 (larger g1/g2 coefficients amplify Z-errors).
tuna9.mitigation: REM+PS (confusion matrix inversion then Z-parity post-selection)

comparisons.description: HeH+ potential energy curve matches FCI across bond distances

emulator.failure_description: Replication matches published results within error bars

ibm_torino.failure_description: Mitigation ladder at 3 distances: TREX achieves 4.31-7.26 kcal/mol (mean 5.34). Best: R=1.50 TREX=4.31 kcal/mol. Still fails chemical accuracy (1.0 kcal/mol). Original SamplerV2 results: 11 distances, 0/11 chemical accuracy, MAE=83.5 kcal/mol. EstimatorV2+TREX reduces by ~16x.

tuna9.failure_description: Single-point at R=0.75A only (not full curve). 4.44 kcal/mol with REM+PS on q[4,6]. Significantly better than IBM Torino MAE (83.5 kcal/mol). Full curve would require additional hardware time.
tuna9.note: Single-point only, not comparable to 11-point IBM curve

emulator.failure_description: Replication matches published results within error bars

ibm_torino.failure_description: TREX achieves 4.26x improvement at R=0.75 (raw=18.94 → TREX=4.45 kcal/mol). At R=1.50, 3.88x improvement (raw=16.73 → TREX=4.31). All 3 distances show 2.3-4.3x improvement, exceeding published 1.5x claim. DD hurts TREX (same as H2 finding).

tuna9.failure_description: REM+PS achieves 7.9x improvement over raw (35.24 → 4.44 kcal/mol) on q[4,6]. Exceeds published 1.5x claim. Five strategies tested: raw, PS, REM, REM+PS, hybrid PS+REM.

summary.notes: Updated 2026-02-10 with IBM mitigation ladder (9 jobs, 98s QPU). TREX best: 4.31 kcal/mol (R=1.50), 4.45 kcal/mol (R=0.75). Prediction CONFIRMED: coefficient amplification (|g1|/|g4|=7.8) prevents chemical accuracy — HeH+ TREX is 20x worse than H2 TREX (0.22 kcal/mol). Noise-resilience claim now PASSES on all 3 backends. DD hurts TREX. EstimatorV2 raw (17-19 kcal/mol) vastly better than SamplerV2+PS (91 kcal/mol).
